hard_gate_results.reason: Pinned upstream baseline artifact is present and referenced by active parity artifacts.
Drop-in feature inventory artifacts are present in both machine-readable and markdown forms.
Gap ledger exists with owned entries and closure paths for known mismatches.
Open critical/high CLI parity gaps remain (for example extension flag pass-through and slash-command surface verification).
Open critical/high JSON/RPC semantic and command-surface parity gaps remain unresolved.
SDK contract-shape critical gap remains open for strict drop-in embedding compatibility.
Config/environment parity domain remains listed as open in the active contract snapshot.
Session/error parity domain remains listed as open in the active contract snapshot.
Integration I/O parity domain remains listed as open in the active contract snapshot.
Differential-testing hard gate domain remains open and not fully closed with certifying evidence.
Quality-gates domain remains open; release gate audit currently reports failing evidence-contract status.
Parity documents are now conditioned on drop-in certification verdict instead of strict replacement claims.

blocking_reasons: Open critical gaps: gap-sdk-contract-shape, gap-cli-extension-flag-pass-through, gap-json-rpc-command-semantic-coverage.
Open high-severity drop-in gaps remain across CLI, JSON/RPC, extension lifecycle, integration I/O, and config-default domains.
Contract immediate-status snapshot marks open critical hard-gate domains: cli, json-and-rpc, sdk, config-and-env, session-and-errors, integration-io, differential-testing, quality-gates.
Strict drop-in release language is fail-closed until every hard gate is pass.

evidence_index.description: Normative hard-gate contract and verdict artifact requirements
Owned parity gaps with severity and closure paths
Implementation matrix with strict-claim guardrail language
Recent evidence-contract artifact used by release gate checks
